Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2010 07:38AM karenn wrote: HI.  I just had one done a few day ago and wrote the instructions down.   - Nothing to eat 4 hours before test, but drinking water is permitted.  -drink a lot of water and stay hydrated.  - No exercise day before - no carbs or sugar after dinner night before test - Low carb dinner the night before test such as Grilled chicken and green vegetable is allowed.  ~ No alcohol  ~ Wear loose clothing, with no zippers on top of clothing.  Hope this helps.  Best wishes
Posts.Title: Pet scan questions jms66 Faith316

Posts.Content: karenn wrote: I can't seem to find any info on this.   I walk and hike a lot and am without vehicle and need to have medical supplies with me at these times, I am wondering if  it okay to carry a backpack after mastectomy and node removal without risk of getting lymphedema?  Dx 10/29/2008, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/14 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Backpack after Mastectomy and node removal karenn OneBadBoob

Posts.Title: Backpack after Mastectomy and node removal karenn OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2009 09:40PM karenn wrote: HI.  Thanks for your reply.  No, no meds.  Perhaps either stress headaches or from the uncomfortable neck position during rads which could be exacerbating an previous whip-lash injury.  Unfortunetely,  a brain MRI has been ordered for Tuesday, which I am petrified to undergo due to severe claustrophobia.  Enough torture already!  I am thinking that maybe after radiation is complete in 13 days the headaches might resolve on their own.  Hope things are going well with you.  Thanks again for your reply!

Posts.Content: karenn wrote: hi everyone!  Hope you're all well! I am on my 20th treatment of 33 and experiencing daily non-stop headaches.  Nothing excruciating, just irritating and annoying. Anyone else have such? Wishing you all peace and great health! ~Kat Dx 10/29/2008, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/14 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: radiation headaches, anyone? karenn ggandara

Posts.Content: karenn wrote: I was always led to believe that the PET-CT scan was the gold medal diagnostic tool to detect small cancer pretty accurately and that if it did err it erred on the side of false positives.    Not sure if I trust the PET-CT scan anymore.  had a PET-CT scan done 6 days before mastectomy and 17 days after last neo-adjuvant chemo.  The PET-CT was compared to the scan that was done in Nov. before any treatment and now shows the tumor shrank to 1.5 cm and that all axillary nodes were resolved.  But my surgical Pathology report has the tumor at 2.1 cm and 2 positive axilla nodes (biggest 1.5 cm)  I am a little concerned that the PET-CT didn't detect the nodes.  Is it common for a PET to have such discrepancy? or does the PET allow room for false negative errors or only tumors of a certain size?  Any thoughts on this is welcome..or any one with similar situation..  Dx 10/29/2008, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/14 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pathology & PET scan don't add up? karenn margaret02038
